page.title: 14RIVER AXE
page.content: THE RIVER AXE AND ITS TRIBUTARIES DOMINATE THIS BLOCK. HAVING RISEN FROM THE DEPTHS OF THE MENDIPS AT WOOKEY HOLE,THE AXE WANDERS WESTWARDS TO ENTER THE BRISTOL CHANNEL AT UPHILL.IN THIS PART OF ITS COURSE IT HAS BEEN STRAIGTENED BY MON TO AID NARIGATION.DURING THE DARK AGES,THE TRANSPORT OF PEOPLE AND GOODS INTO CENTRAL SOMERSET AND GLASTENBURY,WAS ALONG THIS RIVER.ITS USE AS A NAVIGABLE COURSE ENDED WITH THE BUILDING OF SLUICE GATES AT BLEADON SOME 150 YEARS AGO. THE RIVERS YEO,LOXTON YEO AND THE OLD RIVER AXE,JOIN THE AXE IN THIS BLOCK.THESE NOT ONLY PROVIDE DRAINAGE BUT ALSO POSE THE PROBLEM OF FLOODING IN WINTER.
